cf.Domain.direction¶

Domain.direction(axis)[source]¶

Return True if an axis is increasing, otherwise return False.

An axis is considered to be increasing if its dimension coordinate values are increasing in index space or if it has no dimension coordinate.

See also

directions

Parameters:
axis : str

A domain axis identifier, such as 'dim0'.
Returns:
out : bool

Whether or not the axis is increasing.
Examples: 
>>> d._axes_sizes
{'dim0': 3, 'dim1': 1, 'dim2': 2, 'dim3': 2, 'dim4': 99}
>>> d.items_axes()
{'dim0': ['dim0'],
 'dim1': ['dim1'],
 'aux0': ['dim0'],
 'aux1': ['dim2'],
 'aux2': ['dim3'],
}
>>> d['dim0'].array
array([  0  30  60])
>>> d.direction('dim0')
True
>>> d['dim1'].array
array([15])
>>> d['dim1'].bounds.array
array([  30  0])
>>> d.direction('dim1')
False
>>> d['aux1'].array
array([0, -1])
>>> d.direction('dim2')
True
>>> d['aux2'].array
array(['z' 'a'])
>>> d.direction('dim3')
True
>>> d.direction('dim4')
True
